metadata.Title: CVE-2023-40283 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - high.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in l2cap_sock_release in net/bluetooth/l2cap_sock.c in the Linux kernel before 6.4.10. There is a use-after-free because the children of an sk are mishandled. It was discovered that the bluetooth subsystem in the Linux kernel did not properly handle L2CAP socket release, leading to a use-after-free vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-40283` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-218-generic - 4.15.0-218.229
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-218-generic - 4.15.0-218.229
